availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Howard Warren (Garrard County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Garrard County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Danica Warren. Farmer in Garrard County in 1850. Farmer in Garrard County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private, corporal, and second lieutenant from September 22, 1862, to July 12, 1865

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Division 1, p. 256A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, p. 718.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0113.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 272-73.
"Howard Warren (1833-1894)," Find A Grave, Memorial 107595522, accessed January 19, 2024, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/107595522.
